00040 #ifndef _ogredatastreambuf_h_cpp
00041 #define _ogredatastreambuf_h_cpp
00042 
00043 // Keeps this file form being documented by doxygen
00044 /// @cond 0
00045 
00046 #include <streambuf>
00047 
00048 #include <Ogre.h>
00049 
00050 #define PHYSDEBUG
00051 #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00052 #include "world.h"
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 namespace phys
00056 {
00057     namespace internal
00058     {
00059         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00060         /// @internal
00061         /// @class OgreDataStreamBuf
00062         /// @headerfile ogredatastreambuf.h.cpp
00063         /// @brief Used in the conversion of Ogre::DataStream into std::stream
00064         /// @details
00065         ///////////////////////////////////////
00066         class OgreDataStreamBuf : public std::streambuf
00067         {
00068             protected:
00069                 /// @brief a shard_ptr to the internal Ogre Datastream
00070                 Ogre::DataStreamPtr OgreStream;
00071 
00072                 /// @brief The size of chunks to grab from files at once defaults to 4Kb
00073                 streampos LoadAtOnce;
00074 
00075                 /// @brief The ammount of bytes that should be load before a given start point when loading.
00076                 /// @details When read from a data source, the amount of bytes set in LoadAtOnce will be loaded.
00077                 /// By default when loading a certain item this will start at the specified point and load the
00078                 /// file after that point. This says howmany bytes should be loaded before that default starting
00079                 /// point. If all streams are simply read, then this should be 0, if there are plans to manuever around
00080                 /// the stream, then this should be higher, based on how far back you plan on reading. By default
00081                 /// this assumes a low value of 128 bytes.
00082                 streampos SeekBackOnload;
00083 
00084                 /// @brief The Maximum percentage of the buffer to be filled with seekback contents
00085                 /// @details Whenever SeekBackOnload is use this value will be used to determine if too much of the buffer is being used.
00086                 /// This defaults to 50%
00087                 Real MaxSeekBack;
00088 
00089                 /// @brief The message to use in pre bounds exception errors
00090                 String BeforeStreamError;
00091 
00092                 /// @brief The message to use in Past bounds exceptions
00093                 String AfterStreamError;
00094 
00095                 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00096                 // Methods inherited form std::streambuf
00097                 ///////////////////////////////////////
00098 
00099                 // Locales
00100                 /// @brief Does nothing, implemented for ease of future coding
00101                 /// @param loc A completely ignored value.
00102                 void imbue ( const locale & loc )
00103                     {}
00104 
00105                 //Buffer mgmt and position
00106                 /// @brief Creates the initial buffer used to begin
00107                 /// @param s The Place to put the buffer
00108                 /// @param n The size of the new buffer
00109                 /// @return Returns this on success, of 0/NULL on failure
00110                 /// @exception This can throw out of memory exceptions
00111                 virtual streambuf* setbuf (char* s, streamsize n);
00112 
00113                 /// @brief Moves the internal pointer around
00114                 /// @param off the ammount to move the pointer.
00115                 /// @param way from the begining, from the end, or from the current point
00116                 /// @param which this only supports ios_base::in, and will not work with ios_base::out
00117                 virtual streampos seekoff ( streamoff off, ios_base::seekdir way, ios_base::openmode which = ios_base::in );
00118 
00119                 /// @brief Moves internal pointer to specificied.
00120                 /// @param sp The place to move the pointer too.
00121                 /// @param which this only supports ios_base::in, and will not work with ios_base::out.
00122                 virtual streampos seekpos ( streampos sp, ios_base::openmode which = ios_base::in );
00123 
00124                 /// @brief Does nothing, but is required and returns success
00125                 /// @details due to the nature of the ogre data streams this does not need to and syncing on the fly is extremely easy.
00126                 virtual int sync()
00127                     {return 0;}
00128 
00129                 //Input Functions
00130                 /// @brief Should get the amount of characters left in the sequence
00131                 /// @returns -1 if no estimate could be made, other wise this returns an estimate of the amount of bytes in the buffer
00132                 virtual std::streamsize showmanyc();
00133 
00134                 /// @brief Gets a sequence of characters
00135                 /// @param s a Pointer to where the characters should go
00136                 /// @param n How many characters
00137                 /// @return This returns the amount of characters retrieved
00138                 virtual std::streamsize xsgetn(char* s, std::streamsize n);
00139 
00140                 /// @brief Can in theory be called by read operations, but probably wont because of our xsgetn implemention
00141                 /// @return always returns EOF
00142                 virtual int underflow();
00143 
00144                 // Default implmentation is ideal
00145                 // @brief Calls underflow()
00146                 // @return whatever underflow() returns.
00147                 //virtual int uflow();
00148 
00149                 /// @brief Someone rewinded too far and now we need to backload the buffer
00150                 /// @param c Ignored, required for compatibility
00151                 /// @return EOF on failure and the current character pointer otherwise
00152                 virtual int pbackfail ( int c = EOF );
00153 
00154                 /// @brief Crashes, in ostream bufs it is expected to put data into the stream
00155                 /// @param s a Pointer to the characters
00156                 /// @param n How many characters
00157                 /// @return This returns the amount of characters inserted
00158                 /// @detail currently unimplimented
00159                 virtual std::streamsize xsputn(const char_type* s, std::streamsize n);
00160 
00161                 /// @brief Crashes, in ostreambufs, this is expected to write characters out
00162                 /// @param c A character to write at the end of the output
00163                 /// @return the amountof characters written
00164                 virtual int overflow ( int c = EOF );
00165 
00166                 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00167                 // Non-Virtual Methods
00168                 ///////////////////////////////////////
00169 
00170                 /// @brief Sets the internal buffer to the Specified location in the stream.
00171                 /// @param Destination The place in the Stream to go to.
00172                 /// @details This uses LoadAtOnce to determine the size of the buffer, and SeekBackOnload to determine
00173                 /// how far into the internal buffer should be placed. This does every kind of error checking that can be
00174                 /// for this stage of stream management/creation.
00175                 void SetInternalBuffer(const streampos& Destination);
00176 
00177                 /// @internal
00178                 /// @brief Used to set the internal buffer with fewer assumptions.
00179                 /// @param BeginPtr a char pointer to the begining of the internal buffer.
00180                 /// @param BufferSize How big is the internal buffer is in bytes/chars.
00181                 /// @param Destination Where in the stream the current pointer
00182                 /// @details This does some error checking to attempt to determine if the default amount of backfill
00183                 /// is appropriate. Then this calles the very detailed SetInternalBuffer to do the Dirty work.This is
00184                 /// intended to only be called from OgreDataStreamBuf::SetInternalBuffer(streampos)
00185                 void SetInternalBuffer(char* BeginPtr, const Whole& BufferSize, const streampos& Destination);
00186 
00187                 /// @internal
00188                 /// @brief Used to set the internal buffer without all the error checking, and in a very precise fashion.
00189                 /// @param BeginPtr a char pointer to the begining of the internal buffer.
00190                 /// @param BufferSize How big is the internal buffer is in bytes/chars.
00191                 /// @param Destination Where in the stream the current pointer
00192                 /// @param BackFill How much to load before the destination
00193                 /// @details This is the ideal set of information for filling our mostly sized base variable size buffer. This performs almost
00194                 /// no error checking. After being run this leaves the ogre pointer at the end of the read input. This is intended to only be
00195                 /// called from OgreDataStreamBuf::SetInternalBuffer()
00196                 void SetInternalBuffer(char* BeginPtr, const Whole& BufferSize, const streampos& Destination, const streampos& BackFill);
00197 
00198                 /// @brief This checks if a given point is in the internal buffer or not
00199                 /// @param BeginPoint This is checked to see if this is inside the buffer
00200                 /// @param EndPoint If 0, this is ignored, otherwise this is checked if it is inside the buffer
00201                 /// @return This returns True if BeginPoint is inside the internal buffer, and EndPoint is 0 is EndPoint is inside the buffer. Other wise this returns false
00202                 bool CheckInternalBuffer(const streampos& BeginPoint, const streampos& EndPoint=0);
00203 
00204                 /// @brief Check if the given points are in the stream
00205                 /// @param BeginPoint This is checked to see if this is inside the stream
00206                 /// @param EndPoint If 0, this is ignored, otherwise this is checked if it is inside the stream
00207                 bool CheckStream(const Whole& BeginPoint, const Whole& EndPoint=0);
00208             public:
00209 
00210                 /// @brief constructor
00211                 /// @param Datum A pointer to the Ogre Datastream that this stream will use
00212                 OgreDataStreamBuf(const Ogre::DataStreamPtr& Datum) : OgreStream(Datum),
00213                 LoadAtOnce(4096), SeekBackOnload(128), MaxSeekBack(0.5),
00214                 BeforeStreamError("Beyond Stream Bounds: Before Stream begins"),
00215                 AfterStreamError("Beyond Stream Bounds: After end of known stream")
00216                 {
00217                     #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00218                     World::GetWorldPointer()->Log("Entering/Exiting OgreDataStreamBuf Constructor");
00219                     #endif
00220                 }
00221 
00222                 /// @brief Can this be read from
00223                 /// @return A bool true if it can be read from
00224                 bool Readable();
00225 
00226                 /// @brief Can this be written to
00227                 /// @return A bool true if it can be written to
00228                 bool Writeable();
00229 
00230                 /// @brief Where are you in the current Stream
00231                 /// @returns The Number of bytes preceding the next byte to be read.
00232                 Whole GetCurrentLocation();
00233         };
00234     }// /internal
00235 }// /phys
00236 
00237 /// @endcond
00238 
00239 #endif
